Class Pen

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pen

  • public class Pen
extends Object
    A Pen is a tool for drawing straight lines on a canvas. Pens are constrained to move in four directions: North, South, East, and West. This class is loosely based on the Smalltalk Pen class and various Turtle Graphics packages that are available for different languages.
    Version:
    1.05, January 9, 2008.
    Author:
    D.L. Bailey Department of Systems and Computer Engineering, Carleton University

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EAST 
      static int NORTH 
      static int SOUTH 
      static int WEST 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pen()
      Constructs a new blue Pen in the down position, placed in the center of the canvas, and pointing East (i.e., by default, it will move horizontally towards the right of the canvas).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pen

        public Pen()
        Constructs a new blue Pen in the down position, placed in the center of the canvas, and pointing East (i.e., by default, it will move horizontally towards the right of the canvas). The pen will draw lines 3 pixels wide.

    • Method Detail

      • changeColour

        public void changeColour(String newColour)
        Changes this pen's colour to the specified colour.
        Parameters:
        newColour - The pen's new colour. Valid colors are "red", "black", "blue", "yellow", "green", "magenta" and "white". If an invalid colour is specified, the pen's colour doesn't change.

      • colour

        public String colour()
        Returns this pen's colour.
        Returns:
        The colour of the lines that the pen draws.

      • direction

        public int direction()
        Returns this pen's current direction.
        Returns:
        The direction in which the pen will move.

      • down

        public void down()
        Lowers this pen down onto the canvas. If the pen was already down, invoking this method does not change the pen's state.

      • isDown

        public boolean isDown()
        Determines if this pen is in the down position.
        Returns:
        true if the pen is on the canvas, false otherwise.

      • isUp

        public boolean isUp()
        Determines if this pen is in the up position.
        Returns:
        true if the pen is not on the canvas, false otherwise.

      • move20

        public void move20()
        Moves this pen by 20 pixels in the current direction. If the pen is down, draws a straight line between the old and new pen locations.

      • moveBy

        public void moveBy(int distance)
        Moves this pen by the specified number of pixels in the current direction. If the pen is down, draws a straight line between the old and new pen locations. The pen is not moved if the specified distance is <= 0.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance the pen will be moved from its current location.

      • place

        public void place(int newX,
         int newY)
        Places this pen at the specified coordinates. No line is drawn, regardless of whether the pen is up or down.
        Parameters:
        newX - The x coordinate of the pen's new location.
        newY - The y coordinate of the pen's new location.

      • turnClockwise

        public void turnClockwise()
        Turns this pen clockwise by 90 degrees: N -> E -> S -> W -> N.

      • turnCounterClockwise

        public void turnCounterClockwise()
        Turns this pen counterclockwise by 90 degrees: N -> W -> S -> E -> N.

      • up

        public void up()
        Lifts this pen up from the canvas. If the pen was already up, invoking this method does not change the state of the pen.

      • xLocation

        public int xLocation()
        Returns the x-coordinate of this pen's location on the canvas.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of the pen's location.

      • yLocation

        public int yLocation()
        Returns the y-coordinate of this pen's location on the canvas.
        Returns:
        the y-coordinate of the pen's location.
